I just lost my father to cancer two weeks ago.
I can assure you that food does make a difference and help the body recover.. hold on to those moments of appetite and make sure he eats whatever he wants.. donâ€™t cut down on anything.
During chemo, my dad was mainly craving sugary foods and seafood.
I thought sugar was bad for him so I tried to replace it with a â€œbetter for him alternativesâ€ until he completely lost his appetite.
Sometimes the bodyâ€™s cravings are part of its healing, the body always knows what it needs.
Please avoid making the same mistake
Also, a very helpful tip is to give him fresh juices on the days he isnâ€™t eating. (I include beetroot in almost everything) that way he at least gets his dose of nutrients.
